newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Notionnel under pressure, target 129.52.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Notionnel under pressure, target 129.52.

text.p: September notionnel futures traded on MATIF are under pressure on Monday, but reasonable support at 129.52 should hold any correction, technical analysts said.

"This market's got a pretty negative tone -- it didn't look very good last week and I wouldn't be surprised to see it coming under pressure," said Marc Ostwald, technical analyst at London Bond Broking here.
"There's reasonable congestion support at 129.52,58 and I don't think it'll get much further than that."
By 0745 GMT, September notionnel were down 0.28 at 129.92, bumping right up against Ostwald's initial support at 129.92,94.
Analysts at MCM YieldWatch in London said Friday's weakness meant the market would probe support at 129.80, the July 15 low.
"A sustained break down there indicates 131.30 as a medium term top for losses towards 129.02 and lower," they said in a note for clients.
They said if the market managed to claw its way over initial resistance at 130.04, it would put the current weakness on hold leaving 130.22 the target.
Ostwald said 130.34 would act as a fairly strong barrier for the contract, followed by 130.60,64, a series of old highs and lows.
"I'd be very surprised if we got beyond that -- it's not looking good," said Ostwald. "There's the potential for a corrective bounce but no more than that."
By 0910 GMT, September Pibor futures were down three basis points at 96.44.
